summary: Charter schools are publicly-funded schools that are governed by independent organizations. From FYs 2006-2020, the Department of Education awarded over 6,000 Charter Schools Program grants ($2.5 billion in funds) to help open or expand charter schools across the nation. title: K-12 Education: Charter Schools That Received Federal Funding to Open or Expand Were Generally Less Likely to Close Than Other Similar Charter Schools
